title: Starting Proficiencies
description: Defines initial proficiency assignments and calculation methods for new characters

calculationFormula.generalFormula: proficiency bonus + attribute modifier + item bonus

examples.skills: proficiency + relevant attribute modifier + other bonuses
examples.armorClass: 10 + dexterity (up to armor cap) + proficiency + armor bonus

perception.description: Ability to notice hidden things and detect danger

fortitude.description: Resistance to poison, disease, and physical effects

reflex.description: Ability to dodge area effects and sudden dangers

will.description: Mental resistance to charms, illusions, and other mental effects

simple.description: Simple weapons like clubs, daggers, crossbows

martial.description: Martial weapons like swords, axes, bows

advanced.description: Advanced weapons with special training requirements

light.description: Light armor like leather and studded leather

medium.description: Medium armor like chain mail and scale mail

classDC.description: Difficulty class for class abilities and spells

backgroundTraining.description: Background grants training in one specific skill
backgroundTraining.additionalLore: Background also grants training in a specific Lore skill

classTraining.description: Each class grants training in a number of skills
classTraining.overlapResolution: If background grants training in a skill the class also grants, choose a different skill from the class list

intelligenceBonus.description: Characters gain additional trained skills based on Intelligence modifier
intelligenceBonus.skillSelection: Player choice from general skill list

skillAdvancement.description: Skills can be improved through level advancement and skill feats
skillAdvancement.levelAdvancement: Gain skill increases at certain levels
skillAdvancement.skillFeats: Gain skill feats that provide special abilities

proficiencyProgression.levelBased: Proficiency bonuses increase automatically with level
proficiencyProgression.classFeatures: Classes grant proficiency improvements at specific levels
proficiencyProgression.generalRule: Most characters start with low proficiencies and improve through class features

hitPoints.formula: ancestry HP + class HP + constitution modifier
hitPoints.description: Total starting hit points at 1st level

armorClass.formula: 10 + dexterity modifier (up to armor cap) + proficiency + armor bonus + shield bonus

speeds.modifiers: Affected by armor, encumbrance, and special abilities

mandatoryProficiencies: All characters must have unarmored defense proficiency
All characters must have unarmed attack proficiency
Background skill training must be applied
skillTrainingLimits: Cannot exceed maximum trained skills at 1st level
Must resolve overlaps between background and class skills
Intelligence bonus skills must be from general skill list
calculationValidation: Attribute modifiers applied to relevant proficiencies
Armor check penalties applied to relevant skills
